newsitem.title: USA: Health Management tumbles on warning.
newsitem.headline: Health Management tumbles on warning.

text.p: Shares in Health Management Systems Inc fell more than 30 percent on Friday after the company issued a profit warning, the latest in a string from health information services companies.
Health Management's warning, which had its shares off eight to 14-1/8 in afternoon trading, follows profit warnings since July from companies including Cerner Corp, Medaphis Corp, HCIA Inc.
But Health Management's main business, information management, makes it a relatively isolated case from others in the group, more involved with installing hardware and software, analysts said.
"Their problems are different," said Anthony Vendetti at UBS Securities. "I believe there are specific problems with particular clients."

Nonetheless, investors hit other health care information services companies' stocks on Friday. Medic Computer System Inc was down 2-9/16 to 30-1/2, HBO & Co slipped 3-1/2 to 54 and Cerner dipped 5/8 to 11-3/4.

Earlier Health Management said it expected fiscal fourth quarter ended October 31 earnings per share of between $0.15 to $0.16. The consensus analyst estimate had been for $0.22 a share, according to First Call.
The company said it expects fiscal year 1997 earnings per share in the range of $0.75 to $0.77 which is below the First Call consensus of $1.00.

Vendetti said he was not recommending buying Health Management's stock at current levels, saying he had concerns that problems the company cited with individual clients during the past quarter could "snowball" to other clients.
